clinical_study.brief_title: Omega 3 Fatty Acids in Patients With Chronic Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of the Supplementation With Omega 3 Fatty Acids in Patients With Chronic Renal Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To study the tolerance and efficacy of an omega 3 fatty acids supplement on renal and vascular function and inflammatory parameters in patients with chronic renal disease

detailed_description.textblock:
In a double blind trial in patients with chronic renal disease, the effects of a 3.7 g supplement of docosahexanoic and eicosapentanoic acids or a supplement of a similar dose of corn oil during 12 weeks, will be assessed on the following parameters:
1. Urine albumin excretion
2. Renal function measured with serum creatinine, cystatin C and beta-2 microglobulin
3. Carotid intima media thickness and pulse wave velocity
4. Inflammation status assessed measuring serum levels of C reactive protein and interleukin 6
5. Metabolic control of diabetes
6. Serum lipid levels

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly selected to receive 3.7 g of a supplement containing docosahexanoic and eicosapentanoic acids or a supplement containing corn oil. The supplements will be provided for 12 weeks
study_design_info.masking_description: Identical sachets containind the study supplement or corn oil will be number coded and provided to participants

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Urine albumin excretion at 12 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 12 weeks of intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of albumin excretion in a 24 hour urine sample

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in C reactive protein levels at 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of c reactive protein in blood samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulse wave velocity at 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 12 weeks of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of pulse wave velocity using a oscillometric device

arm_group.description: Supplementation of 3.7 g of docosahexanoic and eicosapentanoic acids per day during 12 weeks
Supplementation of 3.7 g of corn oil per day during 12 weeks

intervention.description: Omega 3 fatty acids will be provided in a dose of 3.7 g/day, that should be enough to rise red blood cell levels of eicosapentanoic and docosahexanoic acids
Corn oil will be the placebo comparator for omega 3 fatty acids supplement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Urinary albumin excretion over 30 mg/g creatinin
- Chronic renal failure stage 2 to 4
- Absence of serious conditions such as cáncer, decompensated heart failure, chronic infections and severe arterial lesions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Blood glucose levels over 180 mg/dl or glycosilated hemoglobin over 8%
- Presence of cognitive impairment that does not allow to sigin a written informed consent
- Alcohol or illicit drug abuse
